intro: Linaria triornithophora, commonly known as the three-birds flower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Linaria triornithophora typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is well adapted to dry, sunny conditions. It is often found in coastal areas and can thrive in environments with limited water availability.
